transportAdvice: San Diego has a light rail trolley system and bus network that connects major tourist areas including downtown, Old Town, and Mission Valley, though a car is often more convenient for reaching beaches and suburban attractions. Taxis and ride-hailing services are widely available, and many central neighborhoods like the Gaslamp Quarter and Balboa Park are walkable.

weather.description: Mild and occasionally rainy, January is one of San Diego's cooler and wetter months but still pleasant by most standards.
Similar to January with mild temperatures and a chance of rain, though sunny days are common.
Spring begins with warming temperatures and decreasing rainfall, making it a comfortable time to explore outdoors.
Warm and mostly dry with pleasant conditions ideal for sightseeing and beach walks.
May often brings a marine layer known locally as 'May Gray,' with overcast mornings that typically clear by afternoon.
June continues the marine layer pattern called 'June Gloom,' with cool mornings and warm afternoons.
Peak summer brings warm, sunny days with low rainfall and ideal beach conditions.
The warmest month of the year with reliably sunny skies and perfect beach weather.
Often considered the best month to visit, with warm temperatures, clear skies, and fewer crowds than peak summer.
Warm and dry with excellent visibility and comfortable temperatures for outdoor activities.
Mild autumn weather with cooling evenings and very little rainfall, still pleasant for sightseeing.
Cool and occasionally wet, December is the start of the mild rainy season but remains comfortable compared to most of the country.
